Reviews.Title: Samsung is top tier for a reason.
Reviews.Author: PunxZero
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great TV. I was torn between C350, C530 and this. I ultimately went for this because it was the sweetspot for me between price/performance.Pros - The picture is excellent, my friends have Vizios from 2008 ranging between 26" up to 46" and in comparison, they look dim and unsaturated compared to this model from Samsung. 720p/1080i or downcoverted 1080p looks excellent, the picture quality at 1366x768 looks sharper, brighter and more colorful than other budget 32 inch 1080p models I seen. You can only notice stairstepping/pixels if you sit less than 2 feet away. Which with a TV this size would be way too close. I sit 6 feet away and edges are smooth (I have 20/20 vision.) OTA HD with bunny ears/loop antenna looks flawless. Upconverted 480p content looks great for it's format. The amount of options to play with are great. But, even so, this TV looked excellent on it's factory default settings. This TV also has multiple sound settings such as Movie and Clear voice modes. By the way, the speakers are hidden and loud, I have it set to 5-6 volume (out of 50) when using the PS3, 8-10 when watching TV, with very good sound quality for it's wattage.Cons- 8ms refresh rate, many might not notice but, going from a CRT (SD) to an LCD (HD), it was expected. In games it's not really noticeable but, news tickers and other scrolling text it's noticeable, but, this could be related to the TV being 60hz. Another thing is that it's not true 1080p. 1080p content looks excellent however, it's being displayed at 1366x768. This is a subjective thing, at 6 feet away, 1080p and 1080i/720p look the same on a 32". But, if you want to future proof yourself, get the C530/C550. The stand is fine but, you may have to tighten the screws down until the they stop turning to make it stable. 480i non converted SD channels/inputs look so-so.Synopsis - Besides 480i (SD), excellent picture quality for it's class, even better than comparable 1080p sets from other brands. LCD refresh rate will take a few days to get used to if this is your first HDTV.With Prime, this came the next day for a few bucks more, thanks Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Art M. "Art"
Reviews.Content: It was easy to set up and plays cable and DVD's beautifully.Relatively compact size.It has a very special feature for those that are hard of hearing: there is a sound setting called "clear voice".It appears to raise the treble information relative to midrange and bass, and also, makes the distinctions between sounds much sharper.  For those hard of hearing, who usually have good bass/midrange hearing but rolled off treble, this will be a revelation.  No more annoying your neighbors because you have to blast the TV in order to understand the voices.  Also the TV does seem to play closed captions about as well as it can.My aunt is using closed captions on cable TV and standard DVD playback and it works great.  We had trouble using CC on a new upscaling DVD player using HDMI but that turns out to be a problem with the HDMI specification; HDMI relies on the source to decode CC and put the words on the screen, whereas older cable formats and resolutions like composite carry the CC signal distinct from the picture to the TV for decoding.  This appears to be a major step back but it's not the fault of the TV.  If you Google "cc dvd hdmi" you will find a LOT of conversation on the net about this problem.  No one seems to have a solution.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN32C450 32inch
Reviews.Author: EHP13
Reviews.Content: This is a great, very nice looking HD LCD TV for a very good price.  I originally bought the 27 inch Samsung 1080p at Costco, but found it a little small for the space.  I was a little hesitant because of the 720p, but I found that this TV actually has a better picture quality than the 27inch 1080p, and its the same price as I payed at Costco (once you factor in taxes and state fees that you do not have to pay at Amazon).  The size is perfect, the picture is great (with an HDMI cable) and the sound is also much sharper on this TV than the one I returned to Costco.  I even linked my Roku to pandora and am playing it through this tv...sounds great!  My one and only complaint is that the remote control is unnecessarily large.  Otherwise...this is a great TV for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Picture went in 19 months
Reviews.Author: wally "coffee lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in October of 2008. About a month ago the TV started turning off and then back on after I turned it on. Suddenly it stopped turning on altogether. After a little research I found this is not uncommon. Samsung knows about the problem but doesn't care since it's just out of warranty. There is no recall. Big bummer. Do I pay $200-$300 for repair or just buy a new one for $400-$500? Stay away or buy an extended warranty.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase,Update.
Reviews.Author: isidro garcia
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my mom but I now watch it also. I only run standard cable to it but the picture is still rich and clear. My mom doesn't see the benefit of a HD signal but I think she'll come around when I partner it with an HDTV cable box. As good as the picture is what I was even more impressed with was the clarity of the audio. It really makes it enjoyable to watch a movie or show. Kudos to Samsung for including such good sound with their TV's. I had to return a Hitachi 47" LCD because the sound was so weak and tinny. 25% Volume is quite sufficent with this model. If someone has optimal picture settings for this model, please reply. Settings for my Panasonic 50"G10 transformed it.Update-4/28/2010. I played music from a flash drive and it was great. Great speakers once again. Next up-Avatar

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, Superb Service
Reviews.Author: Peter N. Carey
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying my Samsung LN32C450 32-Inch LCD HDTV.  Samsung is clearly top-ranked in the LCD TV market.  My new TV met my high expectations, and so did the seller's service ... delivery time was excellent and exactly as promised.  Hook-ups to cable, satellite receiver, and DVD player were easy.  Picture and sound are outstanding.  Overall, A+++ for both product and service.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: First off, for those that say they had this TV for over a year, this TV was released earlier this year (spring '10).  You are clearly talking about a different model.I don't know if it was the Thanksgiving sale, but for $350, I couldn't resist buying.  Before I stumbled upon the 450 model, I was pretty set on purchasing the 350 model which was around $330.  I'm so glad I found this for this price on Amazon.  It was priced around $500 everywhere else.  It seems there's a big difference in the sound quality between the 350 and 450.  I am no sound expert, but the 450 is more than enough sound for my tv/movie viewing needs.  Other than an additional HDMI port, the 450 allows you to play videos off of a usb thumb drive.  The 350 is only able to play music and photos.As for the picture, simply put, it's amazing.  You can also find configuration settings online to make the picture slightly better.  People mentioned that the color gets distorted at a 30+ degree angle, but if you need to regularly watch a 32'' tv at a 30 degree angle, either you need to move your furniture around or get a bigger tv.  I don't think 32'' tvs are meant for more than 4 people on a regular basis.  For the price, you cannot go wrong with this Samsung TV.  Quality is excellent and you get 1 year warranty (labor and parts).

Reviews.Title: Perfect Break Even Point Between Size / Price
Reviews.Author: Comcenter "Erick"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good size, Samsung tv that would offer all the features of a flat screen tv, and not break my pocket. At the rate technology is evolving it won't be long before we all have to upgrade out televisions again, with larger screen sizes, improved performance and lower prices.LED televisions are still too expensive, hopefully they will come down somewhat in the near future. Plasma is known to be a sucker for electricity, so even with their lower price tag, they would end up breaking my pocket in the end. Thus I decided to go with LCD, decent power consumption and reasonable price.Then I was left with the screen size options. After looking at potential larger screens, I discovered that a 46 inch is almost twice the price, for 10 inches more! I decided to stick with this model, which comes in several screen resolutions. I think the 450 gives you a good value at 60,000 to 1 contrast ratio, compared to lower end 350 model at only 35,000 to 1 contrast ratio, and the price difference is insignificant.I've had this tv for about a week, it feels quite comfortable and easy to use. A few things I found missing where:- This unit does not have a lighted remote.- No SVGA input, which is my best shot at a better image from my cable box.On the Positive side:- It has 2 10w outputs for external speakers (2 x 10w = 20w)- One touch sleep mode.- Lots of features for adjusting image quality like the ones found in high-end tv's.As far as the 720p, you won't miss it. Considering DVD quality is 480p, and your cable or satellite feed is even lower, unless you plug in a Blu-Ray player and play a Blu-Ray disc you won't be missing out on anything. If you will only be using this tv for watching regular television programming, this tv is way more than enough. I hooked up my tv with a high quality RF coaxial cable and I am very happy with the results.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding picture.
Reviews.Author: Mark Bukovich
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV about two months ago for a second TV room.  It is connected to a HD cablebox via component cables.  The picture is outstanding, even without an HDMI cable.  The sound is very good.  I especially like the voice-priority (not actual name, but what I call it) setting where the voice is very clear and audible and does not get lost in all the background noise.  For the price, this was a great buy and we are very pleased with the picture clarity on both the HD and digital-only stations.  Since we've only had it for a couple of months, I cannot make a statement about reliability.

Reviews.Title: Another samsung victim here
Reviews.Author: tideguy
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on 7/1/2010. Today, 12/22/2012, it stopped working. Just went inert, no power indicator light, no response to either the remote or the front panel switch. I couldn't believe it. Spend several hundred bucks on a well regarded model from a major manufacturer, and it lasts only 30 months? You gotta be kidding.Samsung rep "regretted the inconvenience" and invited me to patronize Samsung service center at my own expense, as the warranty on these sets is only 12 months. Probably not worth the hassle. Their service tag ap would not even function with my firefox browser.As far as the TV itself, before it became a brick, I was satisfied with the picture and the sound. That's little consolation now that I am faced with buying a new set 2-1/2 years later. The new set will not be a samsung.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN32C450
Reviews.Author: GrannyCares
Reviews.Content: DON'T BUY.  Another reviewer was correct to label this as a disposable TV.  I bought it in January 2011 and it quit in November 2012.  That's less than 2 years.  I can't afford to replace my televisions every 2 years.  If you can, this is the one for you! I originally loved the TV and bought the next year's model for my daughter.  Now I worry that hers won't last, either.  My TV didn't slowly die, it was a sudden death and it's not worth the hassle to return or try to obtain repair.  I'll never buy Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: Capacitor too small failed at 18 months ZERO customer service
Reviews.Author: K G
Reviews.Content: Having the same issues as the others.  Unit won't power up and has a flashing red light on the front.  First tried to place an online work order and was given a walk in site in NJ and I live in CA.  Called Samsung, indicated it appeared to be ongoing problem with these sets.  Was given a tech transaction number and transferred to a personal services advocate representative, so was briefly hopeful.  I was told my unit was not one of the units they were repairing.  First, get a map, I am not walking the unit across the country.  Second, their solution was that I give them a credit card hold of $125.00 then pay additional funds to ship it to them.  Then, they would let me know the repair costs after they received it.  Same thing, even with the supervisor, not covered as warranty expired.  With my experience, they are covering some units, just not mine.  DON'T purchase.  It had a nice picture, but so did a lot of other brands that actually back their product and have a basic concept of customer service.  FYI, part that failed cost less than $1. Spend the extra $200 to get a better brand, because you will be spending it in a year or two anyway to fix this one.

Reviews.Title: defective power supply
Reviews.Author: Christopher D'Amico "MockSwede"
Reviews.Content: This model, and many other Samsung TVs, are suffering from faulty capacity groups on the power supply and whole unit fails after days to months.  Samsung and Amazon will NOT honor State's laws regarding implied warranty and implied merchantability.  Both of their customer service offices are somewhere between less then helpful and downright rude.  Amazon refused to replace with same unit currently for sale but refused two weeks ago, because they didn't have any 'for sale by Amazon.com'.  And now they do, again.  So, it's a shell game.  Samsung has been alerted to this defect since 2004 and now there is a class action lawsuit.  None of this information mattered to Amazon.com - they are still selling Samsung CRAP!  If you don't believe there is a pervasive defect issue with Samsung TV, do a websearch for the class action lawsuit.

Reviews.Title: I see a recall with this model. Fire hazzard!!
Reviews.Author: Mark E Boito
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of this TV as of writing this review. With the first one, the power cable was very loose where it connected to the TV. Yes it was firmly pushed in. It still had lots of play (wiggle) in it. While auto programming the TV I began to hear electrical popping sounds. The TV cut off once it hit 81% completion. I plugged it into a surge protector as I do all of my electronics. I checked the power cable connection at the TV and after barely touching it, the TV cut back on. While touching the power cable the TV cut on and off several times and I continued to hear electrical popping sounds. That night I left it unplugged as I did not want to start a possible FIRE. Needless to say I returned this TV the day after I bought it.TV #2: The power cable is still a little looser than any previous TV I have connected. I've hooked up hundreds of TVs since I am in the electronics business. At least this TV is not making the dangerous popping sounds. I will keep on eye out for a possible RECALL on it just to be on the safe side. Samsung definitely dropped the ball on this model.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the $.
Reviews.Author: Meggie G.
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv in January 2011... It had a great picture and great sound.. Today it stopped working.. It went off and has never been heard again..:(  I went on the help site and texted  the Samsung rep.  He told me to try plugging the set directly into the wall instead of into a surge strip.. I did.. Nothing happened.  Then he explained that my tv had "malfunctioned."  He suggested setting up a repair time with Samsung..  Like other reviewers of this tv, I am not rich.  I cannot afford to pay around $400 for a tv every two years.. This will be the last money that Samsung gets from me..

Reviews.Title: It Died
Reviews.Author: Gary Mahe
Reviews.Content: This TV has some great bells and whistles but they will not work if the TV will not turn on (Power up).  Samsung knows about the BAD CAPS that come with these TV's and other models made by Samsung but will not fix this one.  Do NOT buy this product.

Reviews.Title: TV will not power on after 1.5yrs of use
Reviews.Author: Griffy
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV back in 2010 and several months ago the TV started to have difficulty turning on.  The red indicator light would flash red several times and the TV would not power on.  After unplugging the power cord from the set and plugging it back in the TV would occasionally work.  Now, the TV will not turn on at all.  I called Samsung and they would not repair the set.  After researching,  I found that the power board is failing and that this problem is common among several different model numbers over the years. I attempted to replace the capacitors after Samsung would not repair it, as many have done successfully, but my TV would not turn back on.

Reviews.Title: Great while it lasted...
Reviews.Author: chiefandsarge
Reviews.Content: So this tv was great for the first eighteen months we had it.  Then one day, it just wouldn't turn on.  I've always loved Samsung products (we have a Samsung LCD that we bought in 2006 and the picture is still better than most other brands on the market today).  Unfortunately, I may be reconsidering my love of Samsung products now, especially if they're going to be selling "disposable" televisions.

Reviews.Title: Great, until it broke.
Reviews.Author: rebecca84
Reviews.Content: *****update*****I purchased 3 of this exact same model for 3 apartments I own. In less than a year and a half ALL three of them have died. Simply put, they quit turning on.  The tv itself had a great picture, but the remote did feel cheap in quality.These tvs weren't getting extreme usage, as each apartment only has one person in them.  I'm completely unimpressed that this tv with a clear flaw did not get recalled.  1 800 samsung offered to fix the tv, but not replace!  Seeing as I live in the Bahamas that means I have to pay for the shipping to the USA, shipping back, and of course...import taxes.  I am absolutely NOT impressed.I will not be purchasing any samsung products in the future.  Even a Samsung telephone!!!

Reviews.Title: LN32C450 RED LIGHT
Reviews.Author: YANO
Reviews.Content: Be Awarer, this TV has a lot of Issues with Sound card and Board components, from power light will start to flash and TV wont turn on, i purchase two one in August 2010 and one on March this Year and the two have the same problem, i also have a Phillips 42" a 47" LG and a 40"Sony in the same house and have not problem with them they all are connect with power protectors.Good look.

Reviews.Title: A great buy for the price!
Reviews.Author: cdbibbs
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son and was concerned with the picture clarity since it is only 720p and was pleasantly suprised with the picture quality.  This TV actually has more advance features than my 1080dp that I purchased last year.  This is a great buy that I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: exceptional picture quality
Reviews.Author: ernest g ruiz
Reviews.Content: this the second ln32c450 tv , the first one had terrible clouding and the media player had audio synch problems.amazon replaced the tv the next day(great service).the audio synch problem is in the media player, playing mp4, mkv and other hd files, the audio is out of synch , even in the replacement tv,samsung sent a firmware update through usb device but it did not solve the audio issue.now i'm not talking about watching reg tv, which has a great picture,it's the media player.i download files from internet to my portable hard drive to watch on tv, so to me it's a big deal.i checked my portable drive on my pc and there is no audio issues from the files i try to play on tv.the tv supports the hd files i have on my portable drive so i dont know what the problem is.samsung wants me to send tv in for repair, but i'm sure that will take up to a month to get done.now i'm  deciding sending the tv back to amazon for refund or samsung for repair.i have yet to read any comments about this issue, it cant be just me.

Reviews.Title: Recommended....with reservations.
Reviews.Author: Katy Lake
Reviews.Content: This is the second Samsung flatscreen I've purchased, so that should be a recommendation for the brand. It is...kinda.Like the previous flatscreen (now relegated to the guest room), this Samsung has brilliant picture clarity. The sound could be better, but for a small room (this is intended for a bedroom), it's fine.There are some issues, though. I started getting this weird stain on the INSIDE of the screen, sort of like a dark smear that is somewhat translucent, depending upon the picture playing on the screen itself. I thought it was me, but no, my husband started to see it. We fiddled around with various efforts (changing the picture quality from "dynamic" to "movie" or "standard", all of which just made the smear more noticeable.)Samsung did send a repairman out, who took the TV and left us stranded for a few weeks. The TV came back, finally, and the picture looks fine. But now I'm waiting for the smear to reappear, and I'm glad we took out an extended warranty!Samsungs have been having issues with the screen and the on/off switch (you can find examples of this all over the Internet.) It doesn't sound like good news, but I'd say if you get a good Samsung, and not a lemon, you're probably in good shape.I'd recommend this TV for the picture and the looks of the set (very sleek and modern.) But try to get it on sale, because it's an awful lot of money to spend on a TV that lasts a year, and definitely, DEFINITELY get the extended warranty!(If the smear reappears, I'll update.)

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: cooper
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this tv.  The picture is very clear.  The only minor drawback to this tv is that the quality of sound is mediocre. If you're putting it in a living room, you had to turn it up quite a bit, but it is definitely worth the money.  I purchased the tv about a month ago.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: badfisch
Reviews.Content: New to the HD world, I initially purchased a Samsung 46in. 1080p 120hz tv. I've recently switched to U-verse HD, & wanted an HD tv for the bedroom to take advantage of the "any room" service. I kid you not - this 720p 60hz tv has as good or better of a picture. the refresh rate of 60hz is more than sufficient - no bluring on high speed movement what so ever.When studying price vs. quality - this is a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Robb
Reviews.Content: This was my first flat screen.  After about 2 weeks of online research and visiting many stores.  I chose this one.  The unit is in a small room and is not my primary TV (but it should be).  Great picture and sound, easy to set up.  I use it for both general viewing and gaming.  I have not experienced power cord issues as have been mentioned in other reviews.  It arrived on time at a great price from Amazon.  I did connect a set of computer speakers w/subwoofer, but it was more for a rumble effect while gaming.  I think the internal speakers are the best I have ever heard.

Reviews.Title: great bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Chadd R. Castrilli
Reviews.Content: this is a perfect tv for a room that doesn't demand top of the line hd. If you want to save a few hundred dollars but still get a tv with a very nice picture n plenty of extras this is the tv for u

Reviews.Title: TV Died After 3 Years. Samsung Says It's "Normal Wear and Tear."
Reviews.Author: O. Miller
Reviews.Content: A TV doesn't normally die after 3 years, but Samsung TVs do. Like others here have said, there's been a class-action lawsuit that covered millions of dead Samsung TVs. Unfortunately, the suit only covered TVs from 2008, and since this one was bought in 2010, it's not covered. When I told the Samsun live-chat rep that obviously later models take longer to stop working, he said it was normal for their TVs to stop working after 2-3 years due to "normal wear and tear."Unfortunately, while people may read all the 1-star reviews for this model, they will not see this review if they plan to buy newer Samsungs, only to leave similar reviews in a couple of years. Terrible brand. Avoid anything made by them.

Reviews.Title: Suddenly stopped working
Reviews.Author: K. Hansen
Reviews.Content: Purchased in January 2011, this TV had moderate use and was great while it lasted.  The set suddenly turned off by itself last week and won't turn back on.  Samsung support offered multiple suggestions to no avail, and the TV has long been out of warranty.  No way I'm paying the cost of repair when it is likely cheaper to just get a new set.The power LED remains solid when plugged in.  I checked the output voltages from the power supply and they were all much lower than specification.  I found the replacement board BN44-00338A on Amazon and other online retailers and will attempt to replace the existing PSU.UPDATE: Replacing the power supply worked, and the TV is functional again.

Reviews.Title: Please don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: P. M. Secor
Reviews.Content: It's been about 2 yrs and 5 months since I bought this set in 2011 for $400.  It no longer works.  It turned itself off and I can't get it back on.  I contacted Samsung and because the warranty is only for 2 yrs, there's nothing they can do.  When I bought this TV I was also considering an LG.  I'm  now going to buy the LG and am kicking myself for not going with LG in the first place.  No matter what brand you decide to buy, please don't get a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: No picture, no customer service.
Reviews.Author: Kim & Wyatt
Reviews.Content: Common capacitor issue like others.  Samsung even suggested that it was the capacitors during the call to tech support, yet Samsung refused to stand behind their product.  Fair enough, it is out of warranty, and why should a tv last more than two years. Solution, buy a Sony.

Reviews.Title: bad set 32 inch SAMSUNG LN32C450
Reviews.Author: Linda P. Pedigo "lindap.p."
Reviews.Content: Purchased set 2-22-11. Had this set go out in  June 2013, had been having problems with it turning off (I thought) all of 2013. Power supply went out at a cost of $260. New set was $268. THIS SET SHOULD STILL BE RUNNING TROUBLE FREE!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed with this TV and Samsung.
Reviews.Author: Bethwr "Beth"
Reviews.Content: Check around on the internet about this model before you purchase.  I was very happy with  it for 22 months, and then it stopped turning on.  Samsung is aware of the problem, linked to faulty capacitors, and they've settled some class action lawsuits; however, this specific model is not included in the suit.  Really a shame - they refused to help me, and I own four Samsung TVs. . .

Reviews.Title: great while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Vegas Slim
Reviews.Content: Add me to the list of folks who bought this product only to have it fail after 1 to 2 years of use. I own several larger Samsung LCD TVs and have never had a problem with them. This TV was for a work out room and I made a mistake of buying something cheaper thinking it would be the same quality as other Samsung TVs. I was wrong.I bought the TV on March 1, 2011 and it died December 18, 2012. What a waste of $404.92. I contacted Samsung and was told the set is not covered by any warranty and there is nothing it would do. Of course I knew the warranty was expired but I had hoped Samsung would stand behind this product given the high number of similar experiences people have had.While the TV worked it as perfect for my home gym. The clarity for a 720p was good and I had no regrets. I recently (two weeks ago) bought a UN60ES7500 60-Inch and I now wonder if I should return it in fear of the same outcome as this model.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality/Poor Service
Reviews.Author: Well Enough
Reviews.Content: This TV is like new--its hardly ever used.After 9 months the audio sounds like rocks rattling in a tin can.Samsung 12 month warranty is a joke. Customer must pay to ship this piece of crap back to the "service center."I have a Samsung cell phone that is equally as bad.At least Samsung products are consistent.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for its Price
Reviews.Author: Gerome
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the bedroom. Great video quality, but I'm not sure on the sound as I always use a sound system. Good amount of inputs and the interface is a better setup than most brands. It looks amazing as well, don't hid this thing!

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: John Wright
Reviews.Content: So just about one month after the warranty ran out, the voice went silly on this one--really tinny with an echo to it.  Avoid this, if you feel you have to buy one, definitely get the extended warranty. Speaking for myself, I will never buy anything made by Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent 32" HDTV
Reviews.Author: mdsbarry
Reviews.Content: I bought my first HDTV some four years ago at about six times the cost of this Samsung 32" HDTV.  No comparison: This one is better by any measure. The best I can offer in a review of this product is that, given an opportunity, I would buy this one again and hang it in the same place on my bedroom wall.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: V. Makker
Reviews.Content: I'm the type of person who waits until something breaks before buying a new one, so I still had an old boxy TV until it finally stopped working. I finally entered the 21st century and decided to buy a flat screen TV. After asking around and reading reviews I finally picked this one because I just wanted something basic and easy to use.The toughest part for me was set-up because I am a total luddite and know very little about cables and cords and whatnot. After several days of calling Samsung and fiddling with things I was able to get everything hooked up properly except for my DVD player, which is (surprise, surprise) ten years old -- I still haven't figured out how to get it to play in any color except blue.If you have components (like a Wii) that come with the old red/yellow/white connectors, be warned that this TV only has hookups for ONE such device. Everything else either needs to be connected with an HDMI cable or the red/white/green/red/blue cables (which I tried to use with my DVD player but still can't figure out).Other than that I have no complaints -- the picture and sound are good and it looks nice in my living room.

Reviews.Title: Great deal on a little TV
Reviews.Author: S. Romano
Reviews.Content: This is the third Samsung I've owed and haven't failed to be happy yet.I picked up this one for a Super Bowl party and now use it in the guest room.Picture is clear and bright, was perfect for the game!  2 HDMI inputs makes it easy to set up and connect to a Tivo and a Comcast DVR at the same time.Wished the stand was a bit bigger, otherwise is perfect for what I need.

Reviews.Title: Love Samsung TV's
Reviews.Author: Henry Wolford
Reviews.Content: I own seven (home and office) Samsung flat-screen LCD TV's and will not buy anything else.  I can't speak to those who have had "power supply" and "capacitor" issues.  None of mine have had any issues since purchase.  Several are used in a break room area at the office.  They are switched on and off a dozen times and run 12 to 16 hours a day.  They have been doing so for more than a year.  I will say you need to be selective of the models in the Samsung line, especially for picture quality.  I always go to the Samsung site to determine which TV fits my needs.  They have a great comparison tool.  I bought this model for a workout area to be used on a Wii and to play DVD's while exercising.  Can't beat the picture quality and I personally believe the Samsung remotes are the easiest to use and understand.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: S. daily "rufferdaddy"
Reviews.Content: A good quality TV for the price. No problems accept I can't get the stupid turn on/off sound to stop. The picture is good not great for TV and perfect for Blu-ray. The TV is well made, much better than a bargin brand like vizio. So for the price hard to beat but I wish the HD TV was a little more stunning like some other sets. All in all I am please with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect
Reviews.Author: WillowB
Reviews.Content: Picture clarity of Samsung LN32C450 HDTV is amazingly good and colors are great even without HD.  I do get a snapping sound after TV has been on for awhile but it only lasts for a second.  Easy to set up out of the box and is lightweight enough for one person to handle which is in stark contrast to the Sony Trinitron which it replaced.  Good buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great tv!
Reviews.Author: AF
Reviews.Content: Just got this today and I am so very happy I gave in to the Cyber Monday sale temptation. Just so you know, it is replacing a tv that was over 12 years old and I don't have any other HDTV experience, but this thing makes me feel like I am really living the high life. It was easy to put the base on and set up and I'm amazed at how clear the picture is. The sound is good too and the whole thing looks like I spent a ton more money than I did. What a great deal.Since I just got it today, if I notice anything you should know as I watch it more, I'll report back in. For now, I am delighted.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Pros:+ Very good picture quality, color accuracy for the price+ Stylish, good looking TV+ Low power consumption (lower electricity bills depending on your previous TV's power consumption)+ Wide array of picture setting options which help optimize picture quality to your liking+ USB connectivity a plus for viewing/listening to content on portable storage devices. Interface is not bad either although I don't really use this feature.Cons:- Picture quality not as great if you are viewing from an angle.  This is common of CCFL LCD panels v. LED, and is to be expected.- TV speakers have mediocre sound quality at best, a non-issue though if you are using external speakers.Overall very good TV for the money.  The only fault I could find performance-wise is that perceived picture quality deteriorated fast as you view from an angle, but it is still very watchable.  This is more a limitation of the technology at the time, and again, at this price point I really can't complain.Highly recommended this set!  Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel Jaquez "Jaquez"
Reviews.Content: I love my new tv, I was very worried before buying this tv cuz I've seen other brands and I didnt like the picture quality. But not with this TV, I get used very fast to the local cable picture its not the best but If you dont have High Def you shoudnt expect more from any of this kind of tv. But the HD with my PS3 its amazing, the sound its also excellent, I dont need to use my computer speaker the ones this TV has its very good. I hope this tv continue working like this because Im really happy with my purchase. Very Recommended.PROs:Good PriceGreat SoundHD Picture ExcellentComputer VGA OutputDigital Audio Output3 HDMI ConnectionsCons:No 1080p - But not all devices are compatible with this setting, so this tv its still the best for me.60Hz - You wont notice that if your not an image expert. But its very important to know wich one are you getting.

Reviews.Title: BEDROOM REPLACEMENT
Reviews.Author: Sandra L. Britton
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT COLOR AND CLARITY EVEN THOUGH AM ONLY CONNECTED TO DIGITAL INPUT.TESTED ALSO WITH OTHER ROOM HD INPUT.

Reviews.Title: Yes, I would recommend to family or friends
Reviews.Author: Igniter57
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung LN32C450.  I bought the first one almost a year ago and have thoroughly enjoyed it.  The TVs are being used in bedrooms, at a 4 - 8 foot viewing distance.  One TV is connected to a digital cable box and the other is connected to a HD cable box.  The picture and sound on both TVs is perfect for the environment they're being used in.  After I had received the first TV,  I had read reviews where individuals were complaining about the stand not fitting properly, and was extremely flimsy and inadequate.  I couldn't understand why so many were having problems because by following the instructions I was able to install the stand in mere minutes and the stand seemed more than sturdy enough to support the TV.  Now I understand the complaints.  The second TV I purchased,  appears to have an identical stand as the first, but did not install so easily.  I struggled over an hour trying to attached the stand.  The screws provided just weren't long enough to fully tighten and secure the stand to the base of the TV.  Fortunately, I had some same diameter screws on hand which were slightly longer and enabled me to secure the base.  Warning for anyone who tries this - The screws must be the same diameter of the original screws, otherwise you risk cracking and or breaking the plastic insert hole.  Additionally, you'll need to make sure the screws are not longer than the hole provided or you risk screwing up into the bottom of the TV.Bottom line - I still like the TV and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Very Good LCD Television
Reviews.Author: GC444
Reviews.Content: I already had a 26" Sharp Aquos I was using and I was really not looking to get this television but I won a drawing for a new one.  Well the one they sent me a 42" Visio that looked horrible so I was able to take it back to the store it was purchased from and pick another one out.  Well I chose this one because honestly it was the best they had for the money, plus the room it was in only needed a 32" television.  The picture quality and color is excellent (much better than the Sharp it replaced), 1080p signals scale down nicely and standard definition signals look ok (the really never do look good on an LCD).  It has two HDMI inputs and two component inputs (one of which doubles for a single composite input).  I have hooked an Xbox 360 and Dish Network HD receiver to it and it looked great.  When I hooked my PC to it the colors looked a bit faded compared to my actual LCD monitor (but that seems to be the case with most televisions) but it would do if I NEEDED a monitor.  However its primary purpose is a TV and it does that very well.  Overall I am very happy with it but it would have been nice to get 1080p and 120Hz, but considering the price I really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Broke down in 13 months! Lost all my money.
Reviews.Author: A. Palekar
Reviews.Content: This model seems to have consistent issues with either the capacitors or like in my case, the LCD panel itself. The screen started showing "black-and-white" picture that looked like photo negatives after 13 months of purchasing. A local TV repair shop gave me an estimate of $375 to fix it. We had to give it away for free in the end as no one was ready to buy it given such high repair costs.While it was working, the picture quality was very crisp and the sound was ok. I called up Samsung after it broke down but they refused to do anything given that the warranty had expired for over a month. They have one less customer to worry about going forward. Never buying Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: Update:  Good TV
Reviews.Author: Zach
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:When I first bought this TV it turned off and on constantly - after swapping out the smart power strip to which it was attached, the problem stopped. In its new state, this TV is really awesome - looks good, sounds good. My girlfriend, who can see colors better than me, thinks the picture quality is quite good.-------------------------------------------Bought this TV week ago off Amazon. It has turned itself off and on at least a dozen times now. I don't know what's wrong with it. I don't understand why Samsung can't make a TV that stays on when it is turned on. In case you're wondering - The power cord is snugly plugged in to the back of the TV, and the TV turned itself off even with the batteries out of the remote. It seems to be mostly be happening when the attached DVD player turns on.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware!
Reviews.Author: Gary Heinz
Reviews.Content: This TV worked great for 16 months. Then 4 months out of warranty the screen would be mostly white with a negative color image when it was first turned on. The problem was temporary at first but now it is permanent. I've seen similar posts from other users. The most common fix appears to be replacing the LCD screen which would cost more than a new TV. I will not buy Samsung again!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32" 450 Series , Worth spending money
Reviews.Author: Ketal Parikh
Reviews.Content: A really good TV and worth spending money. I got this TV spending 20$ more than Samsung 32" 350 series and it was worth. I can watch movies connecting USB drive and that's wat i was looking for and i got it. so need of anything else for wathching movies.Picture quality and sound is good.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: awaygirl
Reviews.Content: I got this for my husband for an anniversary gift.  He loved it so much!  I shopped around several places and I found the best deal on Amazon.  It was here quickly and safetly too.  I recomend this tv to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN32C450 32-Inch 720p 60 Hz LCD HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: D Adham
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on Black Friday and was a bit reluctant because of some of the reviews. My brother bought a Samsung and when I called him he highly recommended the purchase.His advice was great. This TV is worth every penny. Some people were complaining about the sound volume but I still haven't gone over level 14 because it's too loud. The picture clarity and color is amazing. I'm thinking of getting another one for my son's bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money
Reviews.Author: Lexorez
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV so I am no expert.  But the price is right and the picture puts my old standard def TV to shame, and it only cost about a hundred dollars more than my much smaller television which was purchased a year ago.  Sometimes when I try to watch cable the picture is stretched and off-center, but turning the television off and then on again always fixes the problem.

Reviews.Title: poor quality
Reviews.Author: TK
Reviews.Content: After only 3 years the LCD panel is deteriorating.  Based on all the recent reviews I'm lucky that the power supply has outlasted the panel.  This is a poor quality set designed to last only a few years.  My next set will not be a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: A FANTASTIC TV UNTIL IT STOPPED WORKING
Reviews.Author: Bibi the Great "a true genius"
Reviews.Content: It was a fantastic 3 year, 5 month run with this TV, but it just stopped working all of a sudden and out of the clear blue sky. It went dead while I was watching it and I was never able to turn it back on again. The power light remained steady red and would not begin to blink, which would indicate that the TV is turning on or off. The buttons on the lower right hand side of the front of the TV are a joke. I called Samsung toll free and I was advised that it was most likely either a capacitor or a power supply problem. I think that they deliberately make them this way in order to force you to buy a new one every couple of years. I only paid about $400 for it through Amazon...not a lifestyle changer. I watched the hell out of it for 3 1/2 years. Things were made better when they were manufactured in the good old USA, and that's the bottom line. What can you expect from the Samsung South Koreans? Not very much!

Reviews.Title: Great Value for Money...
Reviews.Author: DeepJoy
Reviews.Content: This TV is really great...Like: Nice TV for home...Dislike: I would suggest if you can afford then go for LCD TV with a smart TV option. This is the next gen in TV.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Debbie Cameron
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these TV's as gifts for my parents and they love them.  Very good picture & sound quality.  Could not be happier with them!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase
Reviews.Author: RD
Reviews.Content: I purchased this model (April 2011) and was glad I did.  I own a 22" and fell in love with it so I decided to buy another Samsung.  This model has a media play option so I can view my pictures from a USB flash drive or play podcast from my iPod.  My next purchase will be a Samsung.  Also the customer service is excellent.Amazon did a great job on the shipping, received it within 2 days of my purchase.

Reviews.Title: I don't care what the snobs say
Reviews.Author: GDKay "GDKay2"
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is one picture to be beat. Missing high end features but this is a value priced model, folks! Samsung kept the high quality display and swapped out the extras. The 26 inch version of this monitor was highly regarded by CR. Compared with similarly priced models colors are accurate, the internal speakers are fine, and the video from flash drive works like a charm. No complaints. BTW: Plan to spend some time learning about the picture controls. There are so many and you'll need to find the right combination to suit each source (HDMI vs. Component vs. Composite). A MUST BUY.

Reviews.Title: The best t.v i've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Miss Bri
Reviews.Content: I've had this product for about 6 months and i absolutely LOVE it, it was a great buy for a cheap price i'm so happy with it i'm looking to buy the same exact brand just a bigger size to put in the living room!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32"
Reviews.Author: John B. Anderson
Reviews.Content: TV is awesome.  I dont have High def box attached, just grab HD signal out of the air and the picture is awesome.  Samsung is the best HD flat screen money can buy.  You get what you pay for, dont settle for less.

Reviews.Title: Happy with my Purchase
Reviews.Author: D Bay
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in July and have had no issues.  I use reviews all the time to determine whether to purchase something or not.I've only had this TV for a little while,but the Picture Quality is flawless; I have it connect via HDMI through my Cable Providers HD Reciever.  All HD chanells are amazingly clear, bright, and great way to watch TV.The only issue I would have about this TV would be it's TIMERS option.  It has an extensive ON/OFF Options with up to 3 different options to setup a TIMER.  My only gripe is that you aren't offered the option of HDMI Input but only the TV/CABLE Input.  I'm not sure why your are forced to only use this SOURCE selection, but I have my TV set to turn on at 6am everyday and have to manually change the SOURCE selection to HDMI every time.I'm quite pleased with all the INPUT SELECTIONS offered by this TV as well.

Reviews.Title: So not sure?
Reviews.Author: s
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV yesterday, love the sound quality but is anyone having trouble with the picture quality? I played with the color settings and everything but the picture is still not very clear kind of blurry. I also played with the picture mode. Any ideas from anyone would be great on what levels and mode they have theirs on to make it looks bright clear and not "fuzzy". Other than that I am happy with it but if I can't fix the color I'm gonna have to return. :-/

Reviews.Title: First HDTV
Reviews.Author: Jason Siegfried
Reviews.Content: Fantastic!  This was my first HDTV purchase, and after reading several reviews on top brands, this fit my price range and has incredible picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Judith Satterthwaite "Interfaith Advocate"
Reviews.Content: The TV was received quickly and very easy to assemble.  Our only complaint...and this was our own fault...was that we had thought the screen would be substantially larger than our old TV.  If we had sketched out the measurements beforehand we would probably have gotten a larger screen size.  We like the less bulky profile and the picture quality is great.  Sound is okay as we are not as particular about that.  Someday we may get a larger screen and add extra speakers, but this was a super buy for us.

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: Edwin Jacobs
Reviews.Content: So far this is a great TV for the money. Picture and sound are both excellent!

Reviews.Title: You need to have HD devices
Reviews.Author: Jryerson
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this TV other than the fact that without HD devices the picture is a lil darker than most. I did clear the picture up some after playing with the adjustments for a while. But in all, still very happy and a good purchase. Great job Amazon getting my TV to me quick. Oh and I wanted to thank Fed Ex as well. I wasn't home when they tryed to deliver the TV and instead of taking it back to the warehouse, the driver went well out of his way to get it back to me at the end of his route. Kudos to you!

Reviews.Title: why go out and get hot to buy
Reviews.Author: phyllis crotzer "packing 38"
Reviews.Content: After shopping for months at malls and big package stores, along with independant dealers, nobody could beat the price, along with the convenience offered by Amazon on a top notch product. Item was very carefully packed with instructions to set up written where it did not take a rocket scientist to read them. Picture is actually clearer than what was shown at the stores. The light weight of the tv helps when wanting to move around. The double warning  label about being sure the tv is anchored to the wall or cabinet will prevent someone from just overlooking it and finding it in the floor when the dog or kids bump it. Overall a fine product that makes me very confident when I get ready for my "BIG SCREEN" tv.

Reviews.Title: Very nice picture, and great value
Reviews.Author: theoriginalsubguy
Reviews.Content: To get a Samsung with this good a picture, and in this size is fantastic for the price.  The LN32C450 is a great TV.  I checked this TV side by side with my 46 inch 1080P Samsung 3D LED tv, and you cannot see a major difference with a bluray playing.  See the key is the screen size.  I am a firm believer that 45 inches is the break point at which 1080P is discernable from 720P.  In fact, the 24Hz (available on 120 and 240 Hz tv's) is more important than 1080P, along with contrast ratio.  Unfortunately this TV is 60 Hz only.  I checked out Samsung's 1080 offerings in this size, and they look great too, however, the extremely great value goes away, as those TV's have bigger price tags.But at the price last offered on Amazon, it was the same cost as the samsung 26 inch TV at other online discount brokers.Many websites, such as CNET, and LCDbuyersguide gave this TV a great review and I can see why.  It is the perfect TV for a bedroom, unless you have money for a bigger 45 or 46 inch one, which we do not.  Some say it is great for a kids room, but it is a bit big one kid, again unless you have a lot of money lying around.We love it.  I think you will too.  Go take a look at a local store if you want to be sure.

Reviews.Title: Caution
Reviews.Author: TD
Reviews.Content: The remote started it's intermittent failures at three months. The digital video for antenna reception failed at 16-months. It receives analog audio/video signals and HDMI signals from DVD players and VCRs but only audio from digital antenna stations. Customer service representatives concluded the unit must be sent for repair. Local repair costs start at $250 and can be higher depending on the problem.I am so sorry I bought this Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: JUST ENOUGH
Reviews.Author: Antonio Loera "Tony"
Reviews.Content: This set was to replace a 46" projection TV that had lost it's convergence and was going to cost more than the Samsung to repair.Connected to cable, this Samsung presents a very good picture so long as the signal is strong, and in HD.  Otherwise, it can be grainy, depending on signal quality.  Sound is surprisingly ok, for a set this size and type.  The set up is comprehensive, giving the user a lot of control over attributes.For the money, ok.

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: bonita
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for three years and the picture is just as clear as the day I purchased it . This was a fantastic purchase I will probably purchase another  one day as a gift.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for small price
Reviews.Author: Miguel Goldfeld
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV on October 2010 at Costco, to be used in a windowless room where the kids have the Wii. We use it mostly for gaming and watching movies, the feature of plug & play a USB drive is awesome and very intuitive.I have no idea what are the new models, but for sure that I will stick to this line.

Reviews.Title: Good but lacks features.
Reviews.Author: Smoochy
Reviews.Content: My first experience with this TV came when it arrived DOA. Amazon replaced it quickly and seamlessly. Works very well with Harmony remote. Unfortunately this TV has no good way to run a headphone line out... something I wish I had noticed.  Picture is crisp and clear and audio is decent with plenty of control. Unfortunately the TV freezes up forcing me to dig through the cords to do a hard reboot.  Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32" TV
Reviews.Author: Lee R. Morgan
Reviews.Content: The TV is excellent.  It's much better than the TV it replaced.  The picture clarity is remarkable.  Even my wife and kids remarked about it.  That's no small thing.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Jason Highsmith
Reviews.Content: I have not had the problems listed in the other reviews. It has worked great! I just bought it for a occasional tv use though.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TVs have high failure rate - should be recalled
Reviews.Author: Mark Evans "mark e"
Reviews.Content: Many people are facing a black screen and TV repair bills as soon as 3 months after purchase due to poorly engineered power on circuits.  These are basically the same failures from 70's to current TVs that use super-cheap capacitors to boot up and commonly fail.  Worst problem is the Samsung customer service who will supposedly have it replaced "for free" (the 10 cent part) but only by their one authorized vendor at a substantial $$$ service charge.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, lousy stand
Reviews.Author: Ronald E. Hart "b2ron"
Reviews.Content: The good part is that the picture is good, which is what its all about I suppose. The assembly instruction sheet is above average.The bad part is that the stand is flimsy, which results in the TV being unstable. If you live in the So. California quake zone, avoid this TV.The speakers are poor quality. I don't know what the frequency range is, but it can't be good.I registered the TV online, and it was a pain. They said my nickname was too short (required)! When I made it longer, they said no good, someone else already has it. Blah blah.Not recommended, considering the cost.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and a Great Deal from Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Christina M. Robinson "lovereading"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV today and realized that it was $20 cheaper than I planned on purchasing it for in the first place. In stores, the LN32C450 goes for $444 (the cheapest I have seen it) plus tax! I almost fell out of my chair when I realized that the price went down and ordered it immediately. Thanks to Amazon Prime, it will be here tomorrow and I will update as to the quality :) LOVE YOU AMAZON!!!

Reviews.Title: Needs HD
Reviews.Author: GaryB
Reviews.Content: Picture clarity is great but the images are distorted at times.  I was told that it is because I don't have HD signal.  There was no mention of this possibility when I purchased the tv.  I will add the HD option to my cable.

Reviews.Title: Beware Capacitor Issue with TV
Reviews.Author: K333
Reviews.Content: Samsung has issues with their LCD tv's where the capacitor is not sufficient and leaks. This causes the tv not to turn on. I have had mine for 1 1/2 years and all was great until it just did not turn on yesterday.After searching I came across HUNDREDS of complaints for samsung. See this article: [..]Unfortunately, warranty is only 1 year so the tv is useless and will cost hundreds to get fixed.Don't buy!!!!

Reviews.Title: My TV!!!
Reviews.Author: AshleyR2011 "Ashley <3"
Reviews.Content: This TV Is Great!!!! The Only Bad Thing About It Is, The Alarm Is Not Easy To Set-Up, And Ugg Its Just Difficult To Make It Work, But Everything Else Is GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: Does not function
Reviews.Author: G. Wyatt
Reviews.Content: No picture at all appears, although there is sound.  The set appears to have been delivered broken.  Thanks a lot, Amazon.
